comment: Exposes system related information about the current device.

variables.name: ANDROID_LOW_MEMORY_DEVICE_THRESHOLD_MB
variables.comment: A device reporting strictly more total memory in megabytes cannot be considered 'low-end'.

variables.name: HIGH_END_DEVICE_DISK_CAPACITY_GB
variables.comment: A device reporting more disk capacity in gigabytes than this is considered high end.

methods.name: private static int detectAmountOfPhysicalMemoryKB()
methods.comment:
* Return the amount of physical memory on this device in kilobytes.
     * @return Amount of physical memory in kilobytes, or 0 if there was
     *         an error trying to access the information.

methods.name: public static boolean isLowEndDevice()
methods.comment: * @return Whether or not this device should be considered a low end device.

methods.name: public static int amountOfPhysicalMemoryKB()
methods.comment: * @return amount of physical ram detected in KB, or 0 if detection failed.

methods.name: public static boolean isCurrentlyLowMemory()
methods.comment: * @return Whether or not the system has low available memory.

methods.name: public static boolean hasCamera(final Context context)
public static void logPageFaultCountToTracing()
methods.comment:
* Creates a new trace event to log the number of minor / major page faults, if tracing is
     * enabled.

methods.name: public static boolean isHighEndDiskDevice()
methods.comment:
* @return Whether or not this device should be considered a high end device from a disk
     *         capacity point of view.

methods.name: public static boolean isAndroidGo()
methods.comment:
* @return Whether this device is running Android Go. This is assumed when we're running Android
     * O or later and we're on a low-end device.

methodNames: public static boolean hasCamera(final Context context)
